trans-unit.source: A synopsis and next steps after you have read the Hybrid Identity design considerations guide
trans-unit.target: A synopsis and next steps after you have read the Hybrid Identity design considerations guide

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory hybrid identity design considerations- next steps
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory hybrid identity design considerations- next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you’ve completed defining your requirements and examining all the options for your mobile device management solution, you’re ready to take the next steps for deploying the supporting infrastructure that’s right for you and your organization.
trans-unit.target: Now that you’ve completed defining your requirements and examining all the options for your mobile device management solution, you’re ready to take the next steps for deploying the supporting infrastructure that’s right for you and your organization.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid identity solutions
trans-unit.target: Hybrid identity solutions

trans-unit.source: -Leveraging specific solution scenarios that fit your needs is a great way to review and plan for the details of deploying a mobile device management infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: -Leveraging specific solution scenarios that fit your needs is a great way to review and plan for the details of deploying a mobile device management infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: The following solutions outline several of the most common mobile device management scenarios:
trans-unit.target: The following solutions outline several of the most common mobile device management scenarios:

trans-unit.source: The [manage mobile devices and PCs in enterprise environments solution](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn582037.aspx) helps you manage mobile devices by extending your on-premises System Center 2012 Configuration Manager infrastructure into the cloud with Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: The [manage mobile devices and PCs in enterprise environments solution](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn582037.aspx) helps you manage mobile devices by extending your on-premises System Center 2012 Configuration Manager infrastructure into the cloud with Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: This hybrid infrastructure helps IT Pros in medium and large environments enable BYOD and remote access while reducing administrative complexity.
trans-unit.target: This hybrid infrastructure helps IT Pros in medium and large environments enable BYOD and remote access while reducing administrative complexity.

trans-unit.source: The [managing mobile devices for Configuration Manager 2007 solution](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn508400.aspx) helps you manage mobile devices when your infrastructure rests on a System Center Configuration Manager 2007.
trans-unit.target: The [managing mobile devices for Configuration Manager 2007 solution](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn508400.aspx) helps you manage mobile devices when your infrastructure rests on a System Center Configuration Manager 2007.

trans-unit.source: This solution shows you how to set up a single server running System Center 2012 Configuration Manager so you can then run Microsoft Intune and take advantage of its MDM ability.
trans-unit.target: This solution shows you how to set up a single server running System Center 2012 Configuration Manager so you can then run Microsoft Intune and take advantage of its MDM ability.

trans-unit.source: The [managing mobile devices in small environments solution](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn715906.aspx) is intended for small businesses that need to support MDM.
trans-unit.target: The [managing mobile devices in small environments solution](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn715906.aspx) is intended for small businesses that need to support MDM.

trans-unit.source: It explains how to use Microsoft Intune to extend your current infrastructure to support mobile device management and BYOD.
trans-unit.target: It explains how to use Microsoft Intune to extend your current infrastructure to support mobile device management and BYOD.

trans-unit.source: This solution describes the simplest scenario supported for using Microsoft Intune in a standalone, cloud-only configuration with no local servers.
trans-unit.target: This solution describes the simplest scenario supported for using Microsoft Intune in a standalone, cloud-only configuration with no local servers.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid identity documentation
trans-unit.target: Hybrid identity documentation

trans-unit.source: Conceptual and procedural planning, deployment, and administration content are useful when implementing your mobile device management solution:
trans-unit.target: Conceptual and procedural planning, deployment, and administration content are useful when implementing your mobile device management solution:

trans-unit.source: [Microsoft System Center](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc507089.aspx) solutions can help you capture and aggregate knowledge about your infrastructure, policies, processes, and best practices so that your IT staff can build manageable systems and automate operations.
trans-unit.target: [Microsoft System Center](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc507089.aspx) solutions can help you capture and aggregate knowledge about your infrastructure, policies, processes, and best practices so that your IT staff can build manageable systems and automate operations.

trans-unit.source: [Microsoft Intune](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj676587.aspx) is a cloud-based device management service that helps you to manage your computers and mobile devices and to secure your company’s information.
trans-unit.target: [Microsoft Intune](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj676587.aspx) is a cloud-based device management service that helps you to manage your computers and mobile devices and to secure your company’s information.

trans-unit.source: [MDM for Office 365](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms.o365.cc.devicepolicy.aspx) allows you to manage and secure mobile devices when they're connected to your Office 365 organization.
trans-unit.target: [MDM for Office 365](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms.o365.cc.devicepolicy.aspx) allows you to manage and secure mobile devices when they're connected to your Office 365 organization.

trans-unit.source: You can use MDM for Office 365 to set device security policies and access rules, and to wipe mobile devices if they’re lost or stolen.
trans-unit.target: You can use MDM for Office 365 to set device security policies and access rules, and to wipe mobile devices if they’re lost or stolen.
